text: Miguelina Cobián Hechevarria (19 December 1941 – 1 December 2019) was a Cuban sprinter. She was a member of the 4 x 100 metres relay team that won a silver at the 1968 Summer Olympics, the first Olympic medal ever achieved by Cuban women. After retiring from competition, she coached youth athletes in the Sports Initiation Schools and the Superior School of Athletic Improvement. In November 2005, she was inducted into the Central American and Caribbean Confederation Hall of Fame. Cobián died on 1 December 2019 at the age of 77.Falleció Miguelina Cobián, la Gacela Oriental del atletismo cubano ==References== ==External links== * Category:1941 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Cuban female sprinters Category:Afro-Cuban Category:Sportspeople from Santiago de Cuba Category:Olympic athletes of Cuba Category:Olympic silver medalists for Cuba Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1963 Pan American Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1967 Pan American Games Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1968 Summer Olympics Category:Pan American Games medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Medalists at the 1968 Summer Olympics Category:Pan American Games gold medalists for Cuba Category:Pan American Games silver medalists for Cuba Category:Olympic silver medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Universiade medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Central American and Caribbean Games gold medalists for Cuba Category:Competitors at the 1962 Central American and Caribbean Games Category:Competitors at the 1966 Central American and Caribbean Games Category:Competitors at the 1970 Central American and Caribbean Games Category:Universiade bronze medalists for Cuba Category:Central American and Caribbean Games medalists in athletics Category:Medalists at the 1963 Summer Universiade Category:Medalists at the 1965 Summer Universiade
title: Miguelina Cobián
